intro: Hieracium leucaeolum, commonly known as the white hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, with white rays, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Hieracium leucaeolum is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
